meanings.definition: To coat or cover a surface with a thin layer of plaster or cement.
meanings.sent1: I will parge the wall with a smooth layer of cement.
meanings.sent2: The workers will parge the foundation to protect it from water damage.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy painter tried to parge the ceiling but ended up with a mess.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to parge his heart, leaving it coated in sadness.
meanings.sent5: The artist used a delicate touch to parge the sculpture with intricate details.

meanings.definition: A thin layer of plaster or cement used to coat or cover a surface.
meanings.sent1: The old building had a beautiful parge on its exterior walls.
meanings.sent2: He applied a fresh parge to the cracked wall to restore its appearance.
meanings.sent3: The chef sprinkled some herbs on top of the parge of mashed potatoes.
meanings.sent4: The moonlight cast a soft glow on the parge of snow covering the ground.
meanings.sent5: The delicate parge on the cake added a touch of elegance to the dessert.
